elements.name: Creating a user, and successfully authenticating, for the locke-app

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I should get status "OK"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas" and TTL of "60"
I should get status "OK"
I should get a valid token
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "OK"

elements.name: Attempting to create a user for a non-existing app

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "does-not-exist" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I should get status "Could not find an app with the name 'does-not-exist'"

elements.name: Attempting to create a user that already exists

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "another_password"
I should get status "The given email is already in use for this app"

elements.name: Attempting to create a user with a password that is too short

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpa"
I should get status "Password too short - use at least 6 characters"

elements.name: Attempting to create a user with a password that is too common

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "abc123"
I should get status "Password too common - use something more unique"

elements.name: Authenticating password for a nonexisting app

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "non-existing48585238" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I should get status "Could not find an app with the name 'non-existing48585238'"

elements.name: Authenticating password for a nonexisting user

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "non-existing-user65465642" and password "some_password"
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'non-existing-user65465642' for the app 'locke'"

elements.name: Authenticating password with the wrong password

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "another-password"
I should get status "Incorrect password"

elements.name: Authenticating password with a non-number for TTL

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password" and TTL of "twenty"
I should get status "The parameter 'secondsToLive' must be an integer >0"

elements.name: Authenticating password with a negative number for TTL

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password" and TTL of "-5"
I should get status "The parameter 'secondsToLive' must be an integer >0"

elements.name: Authenticating password with a TTL of zero

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password" and TTL of "0"
I should get status "The parameter 'secondsToLive' must be an integer >0"

elements.name: Authenticating password with a floating point number for TTL

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password" and TTL of "1.2"
I should get status "The parameter 'secondsToLive' must be an integer >0"

elements.name: Authentication token with a non-existing app

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "non-existing48585238" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Could not find an app with the name 'non-existing48585238'"

elements.name: Authentication token with a non-existing user

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "non-existing534752735" and the last token
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'non-existing534752735' for the app 'locke'"

elements.name: Authentication token with an incorrect token

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and the token "apa"
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: Authenticating password with a string starting with a number as TTL

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password" and TTL of "23foobar"
I should get status "The parameter 'secondsToLive' must be an integer >0"

elements.name: Authentication one user with the password of another user

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "some_password"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "other_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "some_password"
I should get status "Incorrect password"

elements.name: Authenticating an unauthenticated user with the token of another user

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "some_password"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "other_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: Authenticating an authenticated user with the token of another user

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "some_password"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "other_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "other_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: One user should get new tokens at every login

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "some_password"
All issued tokens should be different

elements.name: Setting a low TTL, but requesting within time

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas" and TTL of "2"
I wait 0.2 seconds
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "OK"

elements.name: Timing out from the TTL

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas" and TTL of "1"
I wait 1.2 seconds
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Token timed out"

elements.name: Timing out from the TTL and then attempting to use the same token once again

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas" and TTL of "1"
I wait 1.2 seconds
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: Using the second last token

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and the second last token
I should get status "OK"

elements.name: Creating and signing up for a new app

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "OK"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "sallyuser" and password "sallyp"
I should get status "OK"
I get all the apps with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "OK"
I should get apps '{ "sally": { "userCount": 1 } }'

elements.name: Invalid locke-email for creating

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a new app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the token "123"
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'test@user.com' for the app 'locke'"

elements.name: Invalid locke-token

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "sally" with the username "test1@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: App name locke already taken

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "App name 'locke' is already in use"

elements.name: User defined app name already taken

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I create a new app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "App name 'sally' is already in use"

elements.name: Invalid locke-email for getting apps

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "google" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I get all the apps with the username "apa@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'apa@user.com' for the app 'locke'"

elements.name: Invalid locke-token for getting apps

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "google" with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I get all the apps with the username "test2@user.com" and the second last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: Invalid user for getting apps

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "google" with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I get all the apps with the username "test1@user.com" and the second last token
I should get status "OK"
I should get apps '{ }'

elements.name: Invalid user for getting apps

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "google" with the username "test1@user.com" and the last token
I create a user for the app "google" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "google" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I get all the apps with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'test2@user.com' for the app 'locke'"

elements.name: Creating multiple apps

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "google" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I create a new app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I create a new app "rester" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I get all the apps with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get apps '{ "sally": { "userCount": 0 }, "google": { "userCount": 0 }, "rester": { "userCount": 0 } }'

elements.name: Listing apps when there are multiple locke-users with apps

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "google" with the username "test1@user.com" and the last token
I create a new app "sally" with the username "test1@user.com" and the last token
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "rester" with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I get all the apps with the username "test1@user.com" and the second last token
I should get apps '{ "sally": { "userCount": 0 }, "google": { "userCount": 0 } }'
I get all the apps with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I should get apps '{ "rester": { "userCount": 0 } }'

elements.name: Listing user count when there are multiple locke-users with apps

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a user for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "google" with the username "test1@user.com" and the last token
I create a new app "sally" with the username "test1@user.com" and the last token
I authenticate for the app "locke" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a new app "rester" with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I create a user for the app "google" with the username "g1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a user for the app "google" with the username "g2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a user for the app "rester" with the username "r1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I get all the apps with the username "test1@user.com" and the second last token
I should get apps '{ "sally": { "userCount": 0 }, "google": { "userCount": 2 } }'
I get all the apps with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I should get apps '{ "rester": { "userCount": 1 } }'

elements.name: Creating a user, and successfully authenticating, for the sally-app

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I should get status "OK"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas" and TTL of "60"
I should get status "OK"
I should get a valid token
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "OK"

elements.name: Closing a single session

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I close the session for the app "sally" and the user "test@user.com" and the last token
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: Closing multiple sessions

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I close the sessions for the app "sally" and the user "test@user.com" and the password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the second last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: Closing a single session, with multiple present

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I close the session for the app "sally" and the user "test@user.com" and the last token
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and the second last token
I should get status "OK"

elements.name: Invalid app name for closeSession

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I close the session for the app "some-app" and the user "test@user.com" and the token "xyz"
I should get status "Could not find an app with the name 'some-app'"

elements.name: Invalid email for closeSession

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I close the session for the app "sally" and the user "test@user.com" and the token "xyz"
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'test@user.com' for the app 'sally'"

elements.name: Invalid token for closeSession

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I close the session for the app "sally" and the user "test@user.com" and the token "xyz"
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: Invalid app name for closeSessions

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I close the sessions for the app "some-app" and the user "test@user.com" and the password "xyz"
I should get status "Could not find an app with the name 'some-app'"

elements.name: Invalid email for closeSessions

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I close the sessions for the app "sally" and the user "test@user.com" and the password "xyz"
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'test@user.com' for the app 'sally'"

elements.name: Invalid token for closeSessions

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I close the sessions for the app "sally" and the user "test@user.com" and the password "xyz"
I should get status "Incorrect password"

elements.name: Closing a session with another user present

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test1@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test2@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I close the session for the app "sally" and the user "test2@user.com" and the last token
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test2@user.com" and the last token
I should get status "Incorrect token"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test1@user.com" and the second last token
I should get status "OK"

name: Signing up a user using jsonp and GET

elements.name: Delete user

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I delete the user "test@user.com" from the app "sally" with the password "pwwpas"
I should get status "OK"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'test@user.com' for the app 'sally'"

elements.name: Delete user from invalid app

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I delete the user "test@user.com" from the app "sally" with the password "pwwpas"
I should get status "Could not find an app with the name 'sally'"

elements.name: Delete user that does not exist

steps.name: A locke server running locally
I delete the user "test@user.com" from the app "locke" with the password "pwwpas"
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'test@user.com' for the app 'locke'"

elements.name: Delete user

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I delete the user "test@user.com" from the app "sally" with the password "pwwpas!!"
I should get status "Incorrect password"

elements.name: Update password

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I update the password for the user "test@user.com" from the app "sally" with the password "pwwpas" to "p2p2p2"
I should get status "OK"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "p2p2p2"
I should get status "OK"

elements.name: Update password for an app that does not exist

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I update the password for the user "test@user.com" from the app "test" with the password "pwwpas" to "p2p2p2"
I should get status "Could not find an app with the name 'test'"

elements.name: Update password for a user that does not exist

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I update the password for the user "test@user.com" from the app "sally" with the password "pwwpas" to "p2p2p2"
I should get status "There is no user with the email 'test@user.com' for the app 'sally'"

elements.name: Update password with the wrong password

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I update the password for the user "test@user.com" from the app "sally" with the password "p1p1p1" to "p2p2p2"
I should get status "Incorrect password"

elements.name: Update password with a too short password

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I update the password for the user "test@user.com" from the app "sally" with the password "pwwpas" to "p2"
I should get status "Password too short - use at least 6 characters"

elements.name: Update password with a blacklisted password

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I update the password for the user "test@user.com" from the app "sally" with the password "pwwpas" to "abc123"
I should get status "Password too common - use something more unique"

elements.name: Deleting an app

elements.name: Getting a reset email

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I request a reset for the username "test@user.com" in the app "sally"
I should get an email at "test@user.com"
The last email should contain "sally"
The last email should contain "test@user.com"
The last email should contain a valid token
I resetPassword for app "sally" and username "test@user.com" with the last emailed token to "p1p1p1"
I should get status "OK"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "test@user.com" and password "p1p1p1"
I should get status "OK"

I should get status "OK"
I resetPassword for app "sally" and username "test@user.com" with the last emailed token to "p2p2p2"
I should get status "Incorrect token"

elements.name: Creating a user and successfully validating

steps.name: A locke server running locally
A fresh app "sally"
I create a user for the app "sally" with the username "validation@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "validation@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I should get a validation status of "false"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "validation@user.com" and the last token
I should get a validation status of "false"
I request a validation email for the username "validation@user.com" in the app "sally"
I should get an email at "validation@user.com"
The last email should contain "sally"
The last email should contain "validation@user.com"
The last email should contain a valid token
I validate for the app "sally" and username "validation@user.com" with the last emailed token
I should get status "OK"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "validation@user.com" and password "pwwpas"
I should get a validation status of "true"
I should get status "OK"
I authenticate for the app "sally" with the username "validation@user.com" and the last token
I should get a validation status of "true"
I should get status "OK"
